It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1829 Oct. 28th
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from Wednesday October 28, 1829, on which date several civil cases were heard before the Court. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Wensday Wednesday 28th
div.p:
Elizabeth Sutton
vs
Thos. Thomas Berry &
Rich. Edmonson
Trover to recover for a plantation.
The court find for the deft. defendant

John McGovern
vs
The heirs of
Jno John Lowrey
decd. deceased
Debt on note disscontinued discontinued on the grounds of the note not being brought into court.

The court give Judgement in favour favor of the plaintiff for thirty four dollars ten Cents Interest twenty two dollars, forty eight cents, & twelve dollars & fifty cents for cost in a former judgment making in the whole sixty seven dollars & eight Cents- $67.08

p.del: The Court find for the defendant-

div.p: Court adjourned to Thursday morning 10 O'clock-
